meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fusible.
meanings.sent1: The fusibility of the metal allowed it to be easily melted for casting.
meanings.sent2: The glassblower tested the fusibility of the glass by heating it in the furnace.
meanings.sent3: The fusibility of the chocolate made it a challenge to keep solid in the summer heat.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas had a fusibility that seamlessly blended together in the project.
meanings.sent5: The fusibility of the wax crayons made them perfect for creating colorful artwork.

meanings.definition: The ability to be melted or fused.
meanings.sent1: The fusibility of the plastic allowed it to be molded into different shapes.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith tested the fusibility of the metals before forging them together.
meanings.sent3: The fusibility of the ice cream under the hot sun led to a deliciously melted treat.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship had a fusibility that kept them together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The fusibility of the ingredients in the recipe ensured a smooth and creamy texture.
